$description:
| What does this do? | Ensures third party integrated applications are not allowed; restricts non-admin users from creating tenants; Ensures user consent to apps accessing company data on their behalf is not allowed |
| Why should you use this? | Prevents users from registering custom-developed applications and prevents the unauthorized or uncontrolled deployment of additional Entra resources, ensuring organizational control. Prevents users from granting apps access to data, reducing the threat surface. |
| What is the end-user impact? | Users will need to use organizationally approved methods to provision new applications and tenants. |
| Learn more | [How applications are added](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/how-applications-are-added) [Users default permissions](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/users-default-permissions#restrict-member-users-default-permissions) [Configure user consent](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/configure-user-consent) |
